column4: hi, does anyone know how to make the  Intel Corporation Unknown device 4230 wifi card work?
pcmcia or internal?
internal
what is the laptop model?
and maker
thinkpad x61s
running into some issues with wifi and suspend
that card is supported in Gutsy, i'll look for something for Feisty
thanks. i'm running feisty with 2.6.22-9 generic
its the iwl4965 module, i think
yes it is
i am trying to do this -- http://kuscsik.blogspot.com/2007/06/how-to-install-intel-4965-wireless.html
have you looked at this? http://tinyurl.com/3dnzyc
but not sure if it will work
it's hard to get the right patch for the right kernel, i find
yes it is
if you can find the Windows driver (ack!) you can try ndiswrapper too
i found those. the install did not work
does network manager see the card at all
they rarely do
you have a card with new hardware, and it takes some time for the restricted modules to show up
then there is Intel's driver.  doesn't need patching i think http://intellinuxwireless.org/?p=iwlwifi&n=howto-iwlwifi
i'll try that
thanks
so i hope i resolved the wireless issue. now suspend :/
try uswsusp
works faster and flawlessly on my T60
installed that. we'll see how that goes.
great - what about sound -- i have to run this python script manually to get sound to work
huh?
sound is not working natively - i have to run this script for it to work
in a terminal, does alsaconf find anything?
sudo: alsaconf: command not found
there you go!  apt-get install alsa
already in the lastest version
apt-get install alsa-utils
already in the latest version
that's right.  it isn't there in Fiesty.  i forgot sorry
ok. np
does /etc/init.d/alsa-utils start do anything?
yep. started
and open alsamixer
alsa is muted on install sometimes.  maybe it just needs to be turned up?
it seems like it is in full vol but nothing
no sound
hmmm
Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801H (ICH8 Family) HD Audio Controller
i have the 82801G working with snd_hda_intel
is that module loaded?
which module?
snd_hda_intel? modprobe snd_hda_intel ?
snd_hda_intel
yeah?
just ran that. let me restart and see if the wireless and the sound works. brb
thanks
put it into /etc/modules to load at boot
what else should i put in module?
it will load dependent modules with it
snd_xxxx stuff
ok. brb..
still no sound..
rotten
what window manager?  gnome?
have you checked that both PCM and Master are turned up?
so no sound and wireless is still flaky -- getting the following message on the syslog -- iwl4965: REPLY_ADD_STA failed
when my T60 was new this is the same s**t i went through before driver support caught up
did sound work in the LiveCD on install?
or wireless?
that sucx
5: REPLY_CT_KILL_CONFIG_CMD succeeded Aug 13 00:05:09 mux NetworkManager: <WARNING>^I get_scan_results (): card took too much time scanning.  Get a better one.
try tuxmobile of linux-on-laptops (google 'em) and search for your X61s
never tried the sound on the live cd. i can run this python script that i found for the t series and that works. but i always have to run it
looked already. didn't find my laptop there..
can you put it as an init script to run at boot?
that isn't a pretty fix but it would work
you can pastebin the script for us
which one?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/33530/
yeah, that's messed up
i think you have to wait for Gutsy
it is supported in Gutsy
how would i use that?
when you install Gutsy, if it is like Feisty, it will have a balloon for Restricted-Manager saying the stuff is working
wireless worked find under gutsty but many other things didn't
i had to wait, like you, for new drivers
still am for the fglrx to catch up to AIGLX
new hardware is like that since drivers are slow to appear, it seems
ok. i guess that's what i'll have to do. maybe i'll use my pcmacia card i have -- it's old. probably will work fine:)
just for a little while.  or you have a few other ways to try
i'd try the source again, but do a make uninstall in the dir and a make clean, re-configure etc
i compile my madwifi-ng stuff manually
and most other things, really.  like the fingerprint thing, hdaps, video on my Thinkpad...
thanks for your help and thanks to everyone for helping out
